Fb2 Reader that helps to study foreign languages. I made it for myself and for few my friends. All my source code is published on github with Apache 2.0 License.

The source code of this project can be found in two repositories:

Android specific source code: https://github.com/Vitaliy-Yakovchuk/ForeignReader

Core source code https://github.com/Vitaliy-Yakovchuk/foreign-reader-libs

This project uses other open source projects:

MapDB - fast, simple yep powerful key-value database (Apache 2.0 License) http://www.mapdb.org/

JWI - the MIT Java Wordnet Interface (MIT License) http://projects.csail.mit.edu/jwi/

Jericho HTML Parse universalchardet, that is the encoding detector library of Mozilla. It is using detect correct encoding for txt files. (Mozilla Public License 1.1) https://code.google.com/p/juniversalchardet/

Apache Commons Compress is a library defines an API for working with archives (currently using just to download and unpack WordNet database archive) (Apache 2.0 License)

The application can additionally download WordNet - a large lexical database of English (WordNet 3.0 license:) http://wordnet.princeton.edu/
